content:
The level of detail and realism in that USS Arizona model must have been truly inspiring. It's great that it sparked your interest to get back into modeling.

Ah, painting skills, yes! It's amazing how quickly those skills can rust (no pun intended) when you take a break. But don't worry, it's completely normal. The good news is that with practice, you'll get back into the groove quickly. It's like riding a bike – it might take a little while to get comfortable again, but the muscle memory is still there.

What specific areas of painting are you struggling with? Is it color choice, blending, or perhaps getting the right consistency with your paints? I can offer some tips or resources to help you get back on track.

Also, what kind of models are you interested in building now? Are you sticking to ships, or exploring other genres like aircraft, armor, or sci-fi?

Lastly, have you considered joining online communities or forums for scale modelers? They can be a great resource for learning new techniques, getting feedback, and staying motivated.
